metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2896 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
drivers/hid/hid-ntrig.c in the Human Interface Device (HID) subsystem inthe Linux kernel through 3.11, when CONFIG_HID_NTRIG is enabled, allowsphysically proximate attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointerdereference and OOPS) via a crafted device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2896` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-lowlatency - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
